Class Period

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.Period
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class Period
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class which implements time periods and methods to handle it. initial code by: Marc Karassev, Ana誰s Marongiu; modified by: Marc Karassev, Anthony Sara誰s
    Author:
    Marc Karassev, Anthony Sara誰s, Ana誰s Marongiu

    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Period()
      Default constructor, constructs a new period from now to a week later.
      Period(java.util.Calendar sd, java.util.Calendar ed)
      Constructs a new period with the specified dates.

      Checks if the given date is in the period.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Period

        public Period()
        Default constructor, constructs a new period from now to a week later.

      • Period

        public Period(java.util.Calendar sd,
      java.util.Calendar ed)
        Constructs a new period with the specified dates. If the end date is before the start date, switches them.
        Parameters:
        sd - the start date
        ed - the end date

    • Method Detail

      • getStartDate

        public java.util.Calendar getStartDate()
        Returns the period start date field.
        Returns:
        the calendar object corresponding to the period start date.

      • getEndDate

        public java.util.Calendar getEndDate()
        Returns the period end date field.
        Returns:
        the calendar object corresponding to the period end date.

      • getDuration

        public int getDuration()
        Calculates the period duration in days.
        Returns:
        the period duration

      • daysFromNow

        public int daysFromNow()
        Calculates the number of days between this period's startDate and now.
        Returns:
        the number of days between the beginning of this period and now.

      • today

        public boolean today()
        Checks if today is in the period.
        Returns:
        true if yes, false otherwise

      • dateInPeriod

        public boolean dateInPeriod(java.util.Calendar date)
        Checks if the given date is in the period.
        Parameters:
        date - the date to check
        Returns:
        true if it is, false otherwise

      • overlap

        public static boolean overlap(Period p1,
              Period p2)
        Checks if the given periods are overlapping.
        Parameters:
        p1 - the first period
        p2 - the second period
        Returns:
        true if they are, false otherwise

        Returns a string representation of the period and its fields.
